conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls are extruded with visible thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, rooms read as volumes, and the camera is in an elevated angled/isometric-like view with the roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable room volumes; clean cutaway and stable projection. Minor simplification at some wall junctions/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall massing matches (living/kitchen left, bedroom back/top-right, stair zone on right). Central service core (bath/closet/entry partitions) appears simplified/partially reinterpreted; some wall lengths/partition positions differ from the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Bedroom and living furniture present. Kitchen is not clearly represented (no obvious counters/appliances matching the 2D plan). Bathroom fixtures are not shown; service spaces are mostly empty blocks.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear with consistent materials and no major mesh artifacts. Lighting is adequate and does not obscure layout; openings are readable though simplified.

detected_errors.description: Central partitions/service core geometry (bathroom/closet/entry zone) appears simplified and does not fully match the 2D wall layout and proportions.
Doors/openings and window placements are not fully traceable to the 2D plan; several openings appear generalized rather than placed/sized per plan.
Kitchen and bathroom elements from the 2D plan are missing or not clearly modeled (no clear kitchen run/island, no toilet/sink/shower).

summary: A true 3D cutaway with strong volumetric walls and correct overall zoning, but with notable simplification/mismatch in the service-core layout and missing kitchen/bath fixture fidelity.
